events.message: Customer reported a collision involving their vehicle and filed the initial claim for damages sustained.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident based on the description mentioning a car collision.
An insurance agent was assigned to the claim to handle communications and assist with the process.
Customer was notified that their auto accident claim has been officially acknowledged by the insurance company.
Request sent to customer for police report, photos of vehicle damage, and repair estimates for claim processing.
Customer submitted all requested documents including the collision report and repair shop estimate promptly.
Claims team began investigation to verify the details and assess liability based on submitted documents.
Investigation confirmed the details provided; liability was assigned appropriately and damages verified.
A settlement offer was proposed to the customer outlining the compensation for the vehicle damage.
Customer responded with acceptance of the proposed settlement and expressed satisfaction with the offer.
The insurance claim was approved for payment following customer’s acceptance of the settlement terms.
Payment was issued to the customer’s bank account covering the agreed settlement amount for repairs.
The auto accident claim was officially closed after payment was received and customer confirmed no further issues.
